Package ohos.miscservices.pasteboard

Class PasteData

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.pasteboard.PasteData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public class PasteData
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Represents pasted data on the pasteboard.

    This class provides data records defined by PasteData.Record, and data properties defined by PasteData.DataProperty.

    PasteData.Record contains complex data which is created and added using SystemPasteboard by an application. Data in a Record can be a description of plain text, HTML text, an intent, or a URI. A PasteData object contains one Record instance or a limited number of them. A PasteData object contains one Record instance or a combination of them.

    The size of the pasted data transferred each time within a device cannot exceed 800 KB. Data transferred among devices each time cannot exceed 64 KB, and the data must be in the text format.

    DataProperty describes properties of pasted data, such as MIME types and storage timestamp.

    SystemPasteboard can transfer objects through data URIs, and a recipient uses DataAbilityHelper to read the object identified by the URI. This transfers complex binary objects between applications, such as images and media files.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  PasteData.DataProperty
      This class defines properties of PasteData on the system pasteboard, including the timestamp, MIME types, and additional property data.
      static class  PasteData.Record
      This class defines single pasted data as Record, which can be plain text, HTML text, URIs, and intents.

      • addTextRecord

        public void addTextRecord​(CharSequence text)
        Adds a Record for plain text to a PasteData object, and updates the MIME type to PasteData#MIMETYPE_TEXT_PLAIN in DataProperty.

        Note that after the maximum number of records allowed in the PasteData object has been reached, the addition will be invalid.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the plain text to add. This parameter cannot be null. Otherwise, the addition will fail.
        Since:
        1

      • addHtmlRecord

        public void addHtmlRecord​(String htmlText)
        Adds a Record for HTML text to a PasteData object, and updates the MIME type to PasteData#MIMETYPE_TEXT_HTML in DataProperty.

        Note that after the maximum number of records allowed in the PasteData object has been reached, the addition will be invalid.

        Parameters:
        htmlText - Indicates HTML text to add. This parameter cannot be null. Otherwise, the addition will fail.
        Since:
        1

        public void addUriRecord​(Uri uri)

        Note that after the maximum number of records allowed in the PasteData object has been reached, the addition will be invalid.

        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the URI to add. This parameter cannot be null. Otherwise, the addition will fail.
        Since:

      • getRecordAt

        public PasteData.Record getRecordAt​(int index)
        Obtains a Record based on a specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the record to obtain, which ranges from 0 to getRecordCount()-1.
        Returns:
        Returns the record content; returns null if no record matching the index.

      • replaceRecordAt

        public boolean replaceRecordAt​(int index,
                               PasteData.Record record)
        Replaces a specified record with a new one.

        The record index ranges from 0 to getRecordCount()-1.

        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the record to be replaced, which ranges from 0 to getRecordCount()-1.
        record - Indicates the new record.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the replacement is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

        public List<String> getMimeTypes​()

        Returns:
